text: France has taken part in every Olympic Games with the possible exception of the 1904 Games. In 1904, different sources list Albert Corey as taking place in the games for either the United States or France. The International Olympic Committee's official abbreviation for France is FRA. "Official abbreviations" at The Games of the XVIII Olympiad, Tokyo, 1964, [p. 9 of 409 PDF]; retrieved 2012-10-12. ==History== France has hosted the Games 5 time: *1900 Summer Olympics in Paris *1924 Winter Olympics in Chamonix *1924 Summer Olympics in Paris *1968 Winter Olympics in Grenoble *1992 Winter Olympics in Albertville *2024 Summer Olympics in Paris French athletes have won 671 medals at the Summer Olympic Games. Fencing and cycling are their best sports. France has won 94 medals at the Winter Olympic Games. Most of these are in alpine skiing. ==Medal tables== ===Medals by Summer Games=== 1896 Athens 5 4 2 11 1900 Paris (host nation) 26 41 34 101 1904 St. Louis 0 0 0 0 1908 London 5 5 9 19 1912 Stockholm
